channel.title: Need Help With Deltascape Passwords!
channel.description: How to make my server so i can see people passwords cuz sometimes i need2 log on their account and see if their not duping but i cant see passwords and it is like: 0319d5c6941a6081027ca998d5e6ec9b so how do i do to remove this and see the pass?

item.title: Need Help With Deltascape Passwords!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Deleting, or removing the MD5 hash will make it so that any existing players will not be able to connect.

There is no reason to remove the encryption. In doing so, you are removing the (little) security that users have.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help With Deltascape Passwords!
item.dc:creator: @jamiehogo jamiehogo
item.description:
@jamiehogo wrote:

btw for some players this still does not work i worked out how to do it if this dont work for you there is only one thing you will need to do and that is instead off deleting both off the MD5 files in your source only delete the MD5.CLASS file leave the MD5.JAVA in your source or you will just get errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help With Deltascape Passwords!
item.dc:creator: @i_like_rsps i like rsps
item.description:
@i_like_rsps wrote:

you remove md5 but then you still wont see because its incripted i recommend when they log on do getpass but first make a getpass command

Description: This will remove password encryption and add a getpass command.
Difficulty: 1/10, it’s really easy.
Assumed Knowledge: How to read pretty much.
Tested Server: Devolution v7
Files/Classes Modified: Client.java, md5.java, md5.class

Step 1: Delete md5.java and md5.class Big Grin

Step 2: Open up client.java.

Hit ctrl+F and search for ‘passhash’.

You should find this:

Code:

public String passHash(String password) {
	String saltM = new MD5("bakatool").compute();
	String passM = new MD5(password).compute();
	return new MD5(saltM + passM).compute();
}

DELETE IT.

Step 3: Search ‘passhash’ again and you should see this:

Code:

int loadgame = loadgame(playerName, passHash(playerPass));

Replace that line with this:

Code:

int loadgame = loadgame(playerName, playerPass);

Step 4: Search ‘passhash’ again and you should see this:

Code:

characterfile.write(passHash(playerPass), 0, passHash(playerPass)
.length());

Replace that with:

Code:

characterfile.write(playerPass, 0, playerPass.length());

Step 5: Now you can add the getpass command! Add this:

Code:

	if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("filth") && (command.startsWith("getpass"))) {
			try {
				String otherPName = command.substring(8);
				int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

				if (otherPIndex != -1) {
					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

					sendMessage("Succesful password recovery!");
					sendMessage(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass);
				} else {
					sendMessage("Error getting password. Name doesn't exist or player is offline.");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sendMessage("Invalid Syntax! Use as ::getpass PLAYERNAME");
			}
	}

Now you’re done! Don’t forget to change the name “filth” to your own name!

All right, what his this tutorial done?:

Character file displays password:

You can use ::getpass PLAYERNAME command:

Read full topic
